alliance.translation[0].definitions[0].d: an arrangement in which two or more countries, groups etc agree to work together to try to change or achieve something
alliance.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The companies have formed an alliance to market the product.
Britainâ€™s military alliance with her NATO partners
the possibility of a political alliance between the two parties
alliance.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a group of two or more countries, groups etc who work together to achieve something
alliance.translation[0].definitions[2].d: a close relationship, especially a marriage, between people
alliance.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: a military alliance
NATO has been the most successful military alliance in history.
a political alliance
They agreed not to make any political alliance with the East.
a strategic alliance
Strategic alliances are being forged with major European companies.
an electoral alliance
The weaker Liberal Democratic party was now considering an electoral alliance with Labour.
shifting alliances
the shifting alliances in the Middle East
a strong/close alliance
He forged a strong alliance between his state and the church.
a loose alliance
A loose alliance of opposition groups formed in 1990.
make/form an alliance
In 1902, Japan made an alliance with Britain.
go into/enter into an alliance with somebody
Spain then entered into an alliance with France.
forge an alliance
They won the election by forging an alliance with the Social Democrats.
break (off) an alliance
The Athenians broke off the alliance with Sparta and made alliances with Argos and Thessaly.
alliance.translation[1].definitions[0].d: an agreement between two or more organizations to work together
alliance.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The two insurance companies agreed to form an alliance.
an alliance between the two media groups
The firm said it may need to form an alliance with another company to survive.
alliance.translation[1].definitions[1].d: if two or more organizations are in alliance with each other, they work together
alliance.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The Japanese car company said it would only enter Eastern Europe in alliance with a European manufacturer.
